授業目的: 英文欄参照
授業の概要・背景: This is a high-level course. Therefore, it is advisable for students to have already taken similar high-level courses. Learners will be required to read and listen to native-level English language articles and videos. Please be prepared to work hard.
授業方法:
*The format, schedule, and manner of classes and assessments may change during the semester, depending on student needs, interests, or numbers.

This high-level, content-based class will include elements of lecture and seminar styles, and will be conducted face-to-face. However, assignments/homework/assessments will be conducted, and lesson information/resources provided on Google Classroom. As such, students will need access to a computer at home.

Short lectures will be given by the instructor each week. Students are expected to take notes, as these lectures will introduce the themes of the course. Supplementary readings or videos will be assigned for homework to introduce additional information and deepen students’ understanding. Students will also do further research on these topics.

A key element of the course will be student reflection on personal experiences as relate to the topics we discuss in the course. Students will interact with each other to share and discuss their experiences and ideas about the various topics.

第1回:
Class Orientation:
Introduction to the course, LMS setup
第3回: Performance - At our best and our worst
第4回: Practice - Types and quality of practice
第5回: Learning - What it is to "know" a thing
第7回: Motivation - Theories and history, variables we can control
第8回: Autonomy - Motivation made easier by finding our fit
第9回: Psychology - What do we control; what controls us?
第10回: Physiology - Connections between body and brain (and gut!)
第11回:
Well-being - Luxury or necessity?
Choosing a research topic, introduction to final assignments
第12回: Feedback and work day on research and writing with teacher support
第14回:
Presentation on chosen topics, day 2
Final reflection and plan
